description: Week 1 test corpus - 5 fully annotated scenarios for TagTeam semantic parser validation

scenarios.title: End of Life Decision
scenarios.description: A 78-year-old patient with terminal cancer is on life support with no chance of recovery. The family must decide whether to continue treatment.

physicalImpact.reasoning: Terminal cancer, life support, no recovery - maximal physical severity

personsInvolved.reasoning: Patient and family directly involved in life-death decision

autonomyAtStake.reasoning: Decision about continuing treatment involves autonomy

uncertainty.reasoning: Medical facts are clear (terminal, no recovery), ethical choice has uncertainty

expectedValues.reasoning: Terminal cancer and life support directly engage physical wellbeing
Family deciding on behalf of patient - autonomy central
End of life care relates to human dignity
Family care for patient in vulnerable state

scenarios.title: Leaving Faith Community
scenarios.description: After 30 years in a conservative religious community, I am questioning core doctrines and considering leaving. This would mean losing my entire social network.

physicalImpact.reasoning: No direct physical harm, primarily psychological/social

autonomyAtStake.reasoning: Core decision about personal beliefs and community belonging

socialImpact.reasoning: Losing entire social network is severe social impact

truthClaims.reasoning: Questioning religious doctrines involves truth claims

expectedValues.reasoning: Personal choice about beliefs and community
Religious/spiritual content is central to scenario
Intellectual honesty vs staying in community
Social network and family relationships at stake
Questioning doctrines relates to truth-seeking

scenarios.title: Whistleblowing Decision
scenarios.description: I discovered that my company is falsifying safety reports to avoid costly recalls. Reporting this would likely end my career but could prevent serious injuries.

physicalImpact.reasoning: False safety reports could cause serious injuries

personsInvolved.reasoning: Self, company, potential victims of unsafe products

autonomyAtStake.reasoning: Decision to report or stay silent

truthClaims.reasoning: Falsifying reports is direct truth violation

moralConflict.reasoning: Clear moral tension between loyalty and public safety

expectedValues.reasoning: Falsifying reports is dishonesty, whistleblowing is honesty
Preventing serious injuries is physical wellbeing
Holding company accountable for wrongdoing
Accurate safety reporting vs falsification
Professional responsibility and expertise

scenarios.title: Friend's Infidelity
scenarios.description: My best friend is cheating on their spouse. The spouse is also my close friend and has asked me directly if I know anything. My friend begged me not to tell.

personsInvolved.reasoning: Self caught between two close friends in marriage

autonomyAtStake.reasoning: Decision about disclosure, respecting friend's request

socialImpact.reasoning: Relationships with both friends at risk

moralConflict.reasoning: Loyalty vs honesty, competing obligations to friends

expectedValues.reasoning: Tension between honesty to spouse and keeping friend's secret
Friendships and marriage relationships central
Caring for both friends in difficult situation
Respecting autonomy of both friends

scenarios.title: Climate Action vs Economic Impact
scenarios.description: Our town's largest employer, a coal plant, must close to meet climate goals. This will eliminate 2000 jobs in a community with no other major employers. We must decide whether to allow an extension.

physicalImpact.reasoning: Coal plant affects air quality, climate change has physical impacts

personsInvolved.reasoning: 2000 workers, entire community, future generations affected

resourceScarcity.reasoning: No other major employers creates economic scarcity

futureImpact.reasoning: Climate goals and long-term community viability at stake

moralConflict.reasoning: Present economic needs vs future environmental protection

expectedValues.reasoning: Environmental health and climate impact physical wellbeing
2000 jobs represent material security for families
Fair distribution of climate action burdens
Caring for workers and future generations
Economic transition and sustainable development

notes.coverage: 5 scenarios across 5 different domains (healthcare, spiritual, vocational, interpersonal, environmental)

annotationDetails.expectedParse: Complete semantic parse with agent-action-patient structure, POS tags, tense/aspect/modality, negation
annotationDetails.expectedContext: Intensity (0-1 scale) and polarity (positive/negative/neutral) for relevant context dimensions
annotationDetails.expectedValues: Relevant values with salience levels and reasoning for inclusion
annotationDetails.compoundTerms: Multi-word entities that must be treated as single semantic units
annotationDetails.negationExamples: Phrases containing negation for parser validation

usageInstructions: Use expectedParse to validate TagTeam's semantic role labeling
Use expectedContext to validate context intensity analysis
Use expectedValues to validate value matching against value-definitions-core.json
Use compoundTerms to test multi-word entity recognition
Use negationExamples to test negation detection
